#Text=AC :
#Text=It was a pleasant surprise .
#Text=I do n't think we had realised what the barriers schools faced in using the main Wikipedia were .
#Text=It is n't just pupils posting material about teachers or meeting strangers : the " Random Article " button on every page could potentially deliver an article on hardcore porn .

column1: #Text=We had already started when discussion broke on banning Wikipedia from classrooms and I am sure we benefited from it .
#Text=( (
#Text=WN
#Text=) )
#Text=Can you give an outline of the selection and vetting process ?
#Text=Is it primarily Wikipedians working on this , or are people from the educational establishment brought in ?
#Text=AC :
#Text=It was a long and painful process , even with a really good database system .

#Text=Articles were taken into the proposal funnel from three main sources : direct proposals for inclusion from Wikipedians , lists which came from the Release Version team and proposals drawn up from working through National Curriculum subjects by SOS volunteers .

#Text=In a few cases where we felt articles were missing we asked the community to write them ( e. g. Portal : Early Modern Britain , which is a curriculum subject , was kindly written just for us ) : These " proposals " were then looked at by mainly SOS volunteers ( some onwiki , some offline ) .

#Text=Our offices are in the middle of Cambridge and we get high quality volunteers , who skim read each article and then compared two versions from the article history by credible WP editors a significant period apart ( this picks up most graffiti vandalism which runs at about 3 % of articles ) .

#Text=Once they had identified a " best " version they marked any sections or text strings for deletion ( sections which were just a list of links to other articles not included , empty sections , sex scandals etc ) .
#Text=A substantial sample of each volunteers work was then doubled checked for quality by one of two office staff ( of whom I was one ) .
#Text=We then have a script which does some automated removals and clean ups .
#Text=Once we had a selection we posted it to relevant wikiprojects and a few " experts " and got any extra steers .
#Text=( (
#Text=WN
#Text=) )
#Text=Will you be making use of BitTorrent for distribution again this year ? Was it a success in 2007 ?
#Text=AC :
#Text=BitTorrent was a bit disappointing in that it got us the only substantial criticisms we received online .
#Text=A lot of people find it too much effort to use .

#Text=However for the period we offered a straight http : download we had huge problems with spiders eating vast bandwidth ( the file is 3.5G : a few thousand rogue spider downloads and it starts to hurt ) .
#Text=As per last year therefore our main two channels will be free download by BitTorrent and mailing the DVDs free all over the world .
#Text=At a pinch we will ( as before ) put straight copies up for individuals who cannot get it any other way , and we have some copies on memory sticks for on distributors .
